result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Lamont Potts

defendant.name: Potts, Timothy Lamont
defendant.address: 307 Western Avenue, Fond du Lac, WI 54935

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy Lamont Potts in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Timothy Lamont Potts.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Jury Trial. 
Parties have reached a resolution and proceed to plea/sentencing hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.
Court WITHHELD sentencing for 4 MONTHS to allow the defendant to complete the following conditions:
- Provide proof of completion of a certified gun safety course.
- Complete 30 hours of community service.
If conditions are met by the next court date, the sentencing will be for 4 DAYS TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
If conditions are not met, or defendant does not appear at the next court date, the sentencing will be subject to the Reserve Judge assigned the day of the sentencing hearing.
The Reserve Judge assigned for the day of the sentencing hearing will determine if expungement is granted or denied.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 13.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Timothy Lamont Potts in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial held. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Reserve Branch 13 on 9/19/2022 at 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Timothy Lamont Potts in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy Lamont Potts appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Timothy Lamont Potts in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel advises the Court they are still waiting for some additional discovery and request an adjournment. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Timothy Lamont Potts in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg via zoom.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The scheduling conference was held via zoom.  The state filed an amended information, this case is now retabed to Judge Dee Branch 37.  Defense request a status conference date.  The court order the matter adjourned to Branch 37 via zoom. 
Status Conferece on May 12, 2022 at 2:30pm.
  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.   Amended Information charges Defendant as follows Carry a Concealed weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)  941.23(2), 939.51(3)(a), a Class  A Misdemeanor.
Received & Filed, PRELIMINARY HEARING of Original Transcript (16 pages) commencing 03-16-2022 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Timothy Lamont Potts in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 18JV60 in Fond Du Lac County. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Timothy Lamont Potts in court with attorney Sarah Ann Sargent.  Defendant Timothy Lamont Potts in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
